name: Filipino Fish Stew (Paksiw na Bangus)
author: lola
summary: Filipino bangus (milkfish) is cooked in vinegar with vegetables to make this delicious fish stew. Make ahead and serve with any meal.
ingredients: 1 (2 inch) piece ginger, thinly sliced crosswise, or to taste
1  green bell pepper, cut into chunks
1 small bitter melon, cut into chunks
directions: Remove scales, gills, and guts from the fish
Rinse and cut crosswise into 3 steak pieces
Arrange eggplant, onion, and ginger in the bottom of a 1 1/2-quart pot
Add green chiles and sprinkle with salt
Pour water and vinegar into the pot with the fish
Boil for 5 minutes; reduce heat and simmer until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 20 minutes
Add green bell pepper and bitter melon
Cook until bitter melon is soft to the touch, about 10 minutes more
